availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Henry Payne (Bowling Green miller and attorney)

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky attorney and miller. Fairfax County, Virginia native. Studied law from 1835 to 1837. Married Lucy Loving Payne in c. 1839. Married Euphemia Y. Stubbins Payne in 1846. Elected Warren County Court Judge in 1850.

bibl.p: Thomas W. Westerfield, ed., Kentucky Genealogy and Biography, Volume II (Owensboro, KY: Genealogical Reference Company, 1971), 196. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 24. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 2, p. 26. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 11.
